name: medium sized fridge
description:
Client, aged 68, has been unemployed long-term due to health conditions. It has made it difficult for her to secure a stable income and financially taxing to afford these essential appliances. Without a fridge, she struggles to store fresh food, which causes her to rely on processed foods, that may not fully meet her dietary needs. This affects her overall health and well-being, especially given her existing medical conditions. Similarly, not having a washing machine makes laundry physically demanding and relying on external laundry services can be costly and difficult to manage regularly, further straining her limited finances, and adding to her daily challenges. 

A donated washing machine and fridge would significantly improve her quality of life, allowing her to manage her household more independently and focus on her well-being. We would appreciate if you could source for a working washing machine or fridge that can be passed on to client to meet her needs.

The husband is the only sole breadwinner in the family, he just changed jobs recently and has an unstable income. Client is currently receiving counseling and emotional support with regard to other psychosocial, and emotional issues e.g parenting, caregiving, and stress management to assist her in coping with the current systemic stressors from various areas. Creating artwork has become a vital outlet for the client, providing a sense of purpose and emotional release amidst her daily challenges. Displaying her work using the donated wooden frames will not only validate her efforts but also enhance her self-esteem, offering a tangible sense of accomplishment. The frames will create a comforting environment where her talents are visible, fostering pride and motivation to continue her creative pursuits. This visibility is crucial for her mental health journey, helping her combat feelings of isolation and worthlessness often associated with long-term depression.
